feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The system displays a greyed-out formula in leave policy, indicating it will be replaced by the payroll configuration. This causes user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculator Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: System requires enhancement to automatically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations. The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with support explaining the system calculation follows a specific formula based on service duration and daily wage
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential minor calculation differences between system and manual calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method may not perfectly match manual expectations in all scenarios

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy in Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The specific case showed a difference between 912 and 913 total days, impacting the final calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Nuanced Gratuity Calculation Logic
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a complex calculation methodology for gratuity that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting. The calculation involves segmenting service periods, applying different daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year above 5 years), and using specific divisors (366 for leap years, 365 for standard years) for partial year calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially adding an extra day to gratuity calculations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation between system and manual breakdown
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days worked calculation logic

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage formulas. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match user's initial expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios, particularly for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions on Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate deductions when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Requires module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. Instead of using Basic Salary / Working Days as configured, the system uses a global daily rate that calculates deductions using potentially incorrect salary components.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic recalculates rates based on payroll processing month instead of storing the rate from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for employees working more or fewer than 26 days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator settings automatically override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly edit the leave policy formula when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or simultaneously with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in employee final settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations
limitations.impact: Mid-month departures will not automatically include current month's leave balance

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Days Calculation Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Opaque Gratuity Calculation Process
limitations.limitation_statement: Current system lacks clear documentation explaining the precise calculation methodology for end of service (EOS) benefits, particularly for partial years and leap year adjustments.
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion and manual calculation discrepancies

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Based on Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated based on the number of working days in a month, which can vary
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ month-to-month due to working days variation

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation inconsistencies and manual intervention required to standardize daily wage calculations

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may appear different depending on how work week is configured for each employee or organization

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation inaccuracies for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave management system does not properly sync deduction changes with payroll module when leave requests are modified or deleted.
limitations.impact: Creates duplicate or persistent payroll deductions that require manual intervention to resolve

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays
limitations.impact: Calculation method is fixed and cannot be manually overridden

limitations.title: Time Off and Payroll Module Communication Gap
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation
limitations.impact: Prevents accurate real-time recalculation of salary deductions

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts can exceed expected monthly salary

limitations.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates, potentially causing display discrepancies in February (leap years).
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion due to incorrect remarks, though actual calculations remain mathematically correct

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Formula
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with support explaining the system calculation follows a specific formula based on service duration and daily wage

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy in Leap Year
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The specific case showed a difference between 912 and 913 total days, impacting the final calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Nuanced Gratuity Calculation Logic
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a complex calculation methodology for gratuity that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting. The calculation involves segmenting service periods, applying different daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year above 5 years), and using specific divisors (366 for leap years, 365 for standard years) for partial year calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially adding an extra day to gratuity calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage formulas. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions on Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. Instead of using Basic Salary / Working Days as configured, the system uses a global daily rate that calculates deductions using potentially incorrect salary components.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator settings automatically override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Days Calculation Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Opaque Gratuity Calculation Process
claims_to_validate.statement: Current system lacks clear documentation explaining the precise calculation methodology for end of service (EOS) benefits, particularly for partial years and leap year adjustments.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Based on Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated based on the number of working days in a month, which can vary

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave management system does not properly sync deduction changes with payroll module when leave requests are modified or deleted.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: Time Off and Payroll Module Communication Gap
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation

claims_to_validate.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
